The hundreds of thousands of casualties included soldiers from the north east, Sunderland and players who represented Sunderland AFC.
The club's under-12 group have been finding out more and paying their respects as part of the commemorations.

ğŸ‘ âš½ | It's always a toss-up between two men when discussing the hero of #SAFC's 1973 FA Cup final win over Leeds United
On most occasions, scorer of the winning goal - in this case Ian Porterfield - would be the chosen one, however, Jimmy Montgomery's incredible double save, where the stopper dived to his left to save Trevor Cherry's header and then recovered to block the follow-up from Peter Lorimer often gets the nod from Black Cats' fans.
Which moment gets your vote ğŸ‘ for Monty, â¤ï¸ for Porterfield
